revised_title: On the Causes of the Great Variation among the Earth's Mean Density Measurements
tldr: The author examines the causes of the great variation among different measures of the Earth's mean density, focusing on the methods used, such as the Schehallien, Cavendish, and Airy experiments. The author argues that the Cavendish experiment provides the best approximation to the truth, with less error than the other methods.
